review: I bought this as a gift and wanted to make sure it worked, and how to use it before giving it to my Dad and stepmom.  I know that they don't like setting up wifi access points and always call geek squad when--if i am in town--I can do it for them.  So I tried to set this up, followed the instructions.  I am using an iphone 5, and it autoupdated, leaving my iphone app to lockup unable to do anything.  When it finished updating, I saw the nice landscape screen and was able to confirm the code that links the iphone app to the chromecast, but the step where it then links to my wifi did not work.  I can confirm by the everyday use of my wifi for the last 2 yrs that my wifi works for my iphone, so not sure why this conduit did not work.  The handoff from chromecast wifi to regular wifi failed again and again.  I turned every device in the mix completely off for a minute, hooked them up and still no dice.  Seems the update broke the device and I'll be sending it back to google.
author: hoarselord

review: Its small enough to hide behind the TV, Awesome enough to see HD Vids there.I will not duplicate what other users and reviewers have extensively written about, but i did find a minor snagWell, shouldnt really call it a snag, as it is an unexpected feature...When connecting to Youtube Chromecast compatible sites/applications the streaming is great.however, if you browse to any in-compatible site which does show videos on Flash, and you can stream it via chromecast, there were some significant audio sync issues.on the up side, it showed me that when you use chrome on desktop/laptop, you can not only cast the some additional flash players, but also the entire browser screen on TV.
